decision_conditions: The Oak is situated to the front of the front garden, along the boundary with the public highway.
Swakeleys Road is a busy trunk road through the borough and as a result this Oak has a high
amenity. It significantly contributes to the arboreal character of the local area and has the potential
for a long life expectancy. Local residents were consulted on this application due to the wish to
remove the tree and 3 responses against the proposal were received wishing to preserve a
The application and Arboricultural Report mention they wish to remove Four individual trees and a
group of Cypress' only One of the Oaks (T1 on the application) is protected under TPO 233 (T22 on
the TPO and referred to as T22 in this report). Oak T22 although the largest of the trees within the
front garden (18.7m tall) is also the furthest away from the property (16.5m). It is noted that Oak
roots have been found within the trial holes but as no DNA testing has been completed there is no
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To remove One Oak at T22 within TPO 233.
